data.name: Archer
data.description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Veteran Archer
data.description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets

data.name: Battering Ram
data.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Bombard
data.description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

data.name: Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against armored targets.
+ Anti-armor specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Elite Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against armored targets.
+ Anti-armor specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Horse Archer
data.description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry effective against slower melee units.
+ High mobility
- Weak vs ranged units

data.name: Elite Horse Archer
data.description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry effective against slower melee units.
+ High mobility
- Weak vs ranged units

data.name: Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Early Knight
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful charge attack. Effective against most units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Knight
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful charge attack. Effective against most units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Elite Knight
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful charge attack. Effective against most units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat

data.name: Lodya Attack Ship
data.description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

data.name: Lodya Demolition Ship
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
+ The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Lodya Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Does not require a Dock to drop off gathered Food and gathers faster than a regular Fishing Boat.
- No combat
The Lodya Fishing Boat can be converted to any other type of ship.

data.name: Lodya Galley
data.description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

data.name: Lodya Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship.

data.name: Lodya Transport Ship
data.description:
Can be garrisoned by any unit and uses their sight range. Allows garrisoned units to be transport across water.
The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship.

data.name: Man-at-Arms
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage.
+ High armor
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

data.name: Elite Man-at-Arms
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage.
+ High armor
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

data.name: Mangonel
data.description:
Fires multiple projectiles dealing damage in an area.
+ Effective against massed units
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Militia
data.description:
Light melee infantry equipped with a polearm.
+ Fast moving
- Countered by Archers
- Can't garrison
- Has a 90 second lifespan

data.name: Scout
data.description:
Lightly armed cavalry effective at exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Siege Tower
data.description:
Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
- Weak against armored infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Hardened Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
- Weak against armored infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
- Weak against armored infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Elite Spearman

Infantry best used against mounted units.

data.name: Springald
data.description:
Effective at taking out siege engines at long range.
+ Long range
+ Bonus damage vs. siege engines
+ Attacks without having to set up
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

data.name: Streltsy
data.description:
Most powerful ranged infantry with reasonable melee capabilities. Increased attack speed while stationary.
+ High damage
+ Lower cost than Handcannoneer
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Trader
data.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another player’s Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

data.name: Villager
data.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
- Weak in combat

data.name: Warrior Monk
data.description:
Military-minded support unit that improves combat capabilities of nearby units after it attacks. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
+ High utility in large armies
- Low damage
